title: clean.bash does not remove tools from /bin
body:
by **kenliz@cruzio.com**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. In src directory, run ./clean.bash
2. Change GOARCH setting (say from 386 to amd64)
3. run ./all.bash

What is the expected output? What do you see instead?
New tools and old tools are both in bin.

What is your $GOOS?  $GOARCH?
darwin (was 386, now amd64)

Which revision are you sync'ed to?  (hg log -l 1)

changeset:   4018:bbc290c53f85
tag:         tip
user:        Kai Backman <kaib@golang.org>
date:        Thu Nov 12 16:12:28 2009 -0800
summary:     fix style nit ignored in previous cl

Please provide any additional information below.

Seems clean should remove all /bin go tools without reference to current GOARCH setting.
